body:
LGTM, started a system tests run:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/585/

Ewen said:
"it's ok, normally I'd put that into the template directly in a way that doesn't need any additional params on the service constructor, but this works".
Nice!

@hachikuji I had one more crack at this. If you spot any more potential improvements please let me know. Thanks.

BTW, the junkins error seems to be unrelated to this.
Cool!
System tests passed, merging to trunk and 0.10.1.
Could anyone tell me what I should do if this pull request got failed to pass the check? Thanks.
@guozhangwang @enothereska @mjsax
Just did some cleanup of variable/method/field names based on the recent `member id` to `consumer id` renaming.
LGTM

@ijuma @junrao @guozhangwang Ping for review (when you have time). The goal of this refactor is to reduce the number of components that require low-level knowledge of the message format (i.e. the LogCleaner), and to reduce the number of different paths for compressing message sets.
LGTM. Really appreciate the effort on this PR. It's a huge contribution when you can not only add functionality, but improve the testability of the code.

@dguy 
per comments extracted code into single method
Thanks @hachikuji for your feedback along the way. Very much appreciated.
Ping @enothereska @dguy @mjsax for reviews.

Can I know the next steps here? The jenkins build has failed but the test case that seems to have failed, looking at the jenkins logs, is not related to my change. It would be helpful if someone can tell the same.
The contribution is my original work and that you license the work to the project under the project's open source license.
Closing this PR as a fix was provided as part of [the PR for KAFKA-3144](https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1336).

Resolved conflicts after gradle update
CC @gwenshap @granthenke

LGTM. Thanks for the fix @andrewstevenson 

cc @ewencp

I saw this failure for the first time, is it relevant?

```
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.ResetIntegrationTest > testReprocessingFromScratchAfterReset FAILED

```
LGTM besides @ijuma's suggestion.
Jenkins failure explained in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2056.
LGTM, merged to trunk.
LGTM, the failure is an unrelated streams transient failure. Connect tests are passing fine. Thanks @andrewstevenson!
Oops, missed that this was supposed to be attached to a JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4334
@mjsax seems the failure is not relevant to the commit, how should I handle this situation? Please advice. thanks.

@guozhangwang @enothereska @dguy Please review.
/cc @theduderog
@hachikuji Thank you for the review. Have addressed your comments and rebased to the latest trunk level. @ijuma Can you take a look as well please? Thank you.
@rajinisivaram, will take a look tomorrow. Sorry for the delay.
@enothereska Do you want to help @dguy on this PR to address my comments? Otherwise I can take it myself.
Thanks @ijuma, Assuming tests are passing, LGTM. Kudos to anyone who can remove over 200 lines from the codebase!
LGTM. @theduderog Could you verify if this patch fixed your issue before I merge?

@ijuma Not sure I've seen the above test failure before:

```
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<Message(magic = 1, attributes = 0, CreateTime = -1, crc = 3573431224, key = null, payload = java.nio.HeapByteBuffer[pos=0 lim=4 cap=4])> but was:<Message(magic = 1, attributes = 0, CreateTime = 1477319907056, crc = 2050317473, key = java.nio.HeapByteBuffer[pos=0 lim=4 cap=12], payload = java.nio.HeapByteBuffer[pos=0 lim=4 cap=4])>
```
Will check, thanks.
yes, i'll test it today
LGTM.
Tested and it was WAY faster!  Thanks, @mjsax
Glad to hear @theduderog :)
Unit test passed locally. Merged to trunk.
Also could you paste the time spent on `KStreamRepartitionJoinTest` with your local run before and after the patch, so that we can have some information on how much savings it has?
Hello @picadoh thanks for the patch. Could you take a look at https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2012 and see if it covers your concerns?
yep :) thanks @guozhangwang, great stuff.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Fixed the failure, checked with Jason that the fix was OK. Subsequent Jenkins failure was a known transient failure. Tests passed locally so merged to trunk.
@kawamuray The recent changes are looking good. I'll take one more look in the morning, but seems like this is nearly there.
@amethystic Could you re-open the PR so that a Jenkins build can be triggered again? cc @hachikuji @ijuma for reviews.

@ijuma I had no luck with running jenkins system tests on this branch ([link](https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/590/)). I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong or if jenkins is acting up. Could you please take a look? Thanks.
Will do, thanks for the PR.
Thanks for @ijuma 's suggestion, I have updated the code.
Thanks, LGTM. I also tweaked the creation of `ZkUtils` in `KafkaServer` to use named parameters for consistency. Merged to trunk.
Shall we close this?
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
This fixes the failures as can be seen here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/593/
LGTM, merging to trunk.
@guozhangwang before the patch, average of 3 runs is 47 seconds. After the patch it is 44 seconds. I'm not sure the optimization is worth it.

Sorry for the delay. The release was time consuming. 

Looks good to me. Thanks for the patch. @ijuma thoughts on merging this one.
@enothereska could we profile which part of the `onPartitionAssigned` and `onPartitionRevoked` functions are the bottleneck then?
@becketqin @hachikuji Do you have any more comments ?
@mimaison Thanks for pinging me. I'll take another look today.
Thanks @benstopford. Just noticed the conflict. Will rebase and submit an update soon.

`KStream#process()` is designed to be a sink/endpoint in the DAG. That's why the name is not exposed. Can you elaborate a little more on you use case? Why can't you use `#transform()`?

\cc @guozhangwang
ping @theduderog

> 91492 org.apache.kafka.common.errors.WakeupException

>  91511     at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

@hachikuji I don't apply your patch yet. But on my side, it's seem that WakeupException is popped from `closePartitions`.  Should we catch that in `execute` function?

No problem. Our unit tests caught it over the weekend.

From: Ewen Cheslack-Postavamailto:notifications@github.com
Sent: ‎24/‎10/‎2016 07:31
To: apache/kafkamailto:kafka@noreply.github.com
Cc: Andrew Stevensonmailto:andrew@datamountaineer.com; Mentionmailto:mention@noreply.github.com
Subject: Re: [apache/kafka] check for null timestamp rather than value in hashcode (#2055)

LGTM, the failure is an unrelated streams transient failure. Connect tests are passing fine. Thanks @andrewstevensonhttps://github.com/andrewstevenson!

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2055#issuecomment-255651082, or mute the threadhttps://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJwvZRZlIzCHF5knKYACpex63CIZ-FrGks5q3EKogaJpZM4Kd3AT.
@thijsc Do you want to connect custom processors with topologies defined from the Streams DSL (and being able to sink data from the processor)? I'm wondering if `#transform()` can be used instead?

That's correct. Our use case is that we have a kstream based topology, but there's one set of custom behaviour that I though cannot be implemented with the DSL. Maybe not relevant, but it aggregates hourly data from a minutely windowed ktable and forwards this to a topic.

I was browsing through the docs and `process` seemed to fit the bill best. This is the setup (Kotlin code):

``` kotlin
metricsMinutely.process(HourlyProcessor.Supplier(), "metrics_minutely_windows_changelog")
builder.addSink(
  "METRICS-HOURLY-SINK",
  "metrics_hourly_out",
  "KSTREAM-PROCESSOR-0000000007"
)
```

Of course the increment of the processor name can change if we add a node before this. So this is pretty brittle. My thinking was that if `process` would return its name we could do something like this:

``` kotlin
val processorName = metricsMinutely.process(HourlyProcessor.Supplier(), "metrics_minutely_windows_changelog")
builder.addSink(
  "METRICS-HOURLY-SINK",
  "metrics_hourly_out",
  processorName
)
```

I completely missed the transform function. That actually does exactly what I need here :-). Maybe we could clarify the javadoc a bit? I'd be happy to make a proposal.

Seems `transform()` is the way to go. It will also make your code cleaner:

```
metricsMinutely
    .transform(HourlyTransform.Supplier(), "metrics_minutely_windows_changelog")
    .to("sink-topic-name");
```

And yes, please follow up with a PR to improve JavaDocs for `transform()` and `process()`. :)
retest this please

Is `range()` supposed to be inclusive or exclusive of the endpoint? So for, this PR makes them all inclusive.

The [docs say inclusive](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/a4413fc8a42b0222107cad20835e4461141c2ea2/streams/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/state/ReadOnlyKeyValueStore.java#L46), the [RocksDB implementation is inclusive](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/streams/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/state/internals/RocksDBStore.java#L488), but the [InMemory implementation is exclusive](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/streams/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/state/internals/InMemoryKeyValueStoreSupplier.java#L158).

Not to mentioned that J[ava SortedSet.subSet](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/SortedSet.html#subSet%28E,%20E%29) defaults to exclusive and seems like the more natural choice so it's likely what users expect.

@mjsax @thijsc One caveat of the `transform` call is that, it enforces one-to-one mapping from input records to output records, and if you want to output more or none records, a common pattern would be:

```
stream.transform(...).flatMap((k, v) -> v)
```

One could potentially make this API more user-friendly by allowing the transform call to return none or more records so that we can save the `flatMap` call. See KAFKA-3543 and KAFKA-4217.

Re: `range()` I think we can make it consistent as inclusive everywhere, the `InMemoryStore`'s range function seems to be a bug itself. Could you fix it along with this PR?

Re: API, I think I also agree with @dguy and @ijuma on the new `Range` class that

```
class Range<K>
   private K from;
   private K to;
   ...
   static <K> from(K key) ...
   static <K> until(K key) ..
   static <K> range(K keyFrom, K keyUtil) ..
```

which could be generalized later. At the same time we can keep the current function and reimplemented as `Range.range(..)`.
Made a pass over the implementation, LGTM overall.
retest this please
@theduderog `retest this` does not work for apache repos just FYI :P
thanks, @guozhangwang.  it may have just been a coincidence but it seemed to kick off right after i added that comment

Should you not use lambdas in the second example to make it fair? It may be too late for this, but a nicer way to handle this would be a `values` method that would then make `map`, `flatMap` and `foreadh` available for values only. This is how Scala does it for the `Map` interface (similarly for `keys`).
@ijuma updated
@guozhangwang Agreed. Just to clarify, `transform` is not 1:1 but 1:(0,1) -- if you return `null` no output record will be sent downstream.
Requesting @harshach to review.
Thanks @raghavgautam . I'll go over it.
@ijuma - have you guys had time to evaluate this?
@radai-rosenblatt I haven't reviewed the patch in detail, but it seems like it might be worth including. @junrao, what do you think?
@guozhangwang  Please review
@guozhangwang @enothereska
What is the status of this? Does it need a second review?
Closing in favor of https://github.com/apache/kafka/compare/trunk...shikhar:kafka-4161-deux which feels like a nicer API

Review by @hachikuji.

Link to failure: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka-0.10.1/97/testReport/kafka.integration/SaslPlaintextTopicMetadataTest/testAliveBrokerListWithNoTopics/
@hachikuji @ijuma  please review this PR. Thanks.
@ijuma Can you have a look ? Thanks
@mjsax I made a pass over it, but would definitely like you to make a pass as well.
It's intentional that zookeeper is not specified as the console consumer uses the new consumer in that case. What is the issue that you are seeing?

I followed the quick start as a beginner and got that: 

```
$ kafka-console-consumer --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --topic test --from-beginning
Missing required argument "[zookeeper]"
```

But maybe I did something wrong in the process!
One twist is that I installed Kafka via `brew install kafka`. I'll try again later, from scratch, but wanted to report that in case.
You may be using an older version of the tool.
This patch passed system tests ([here](https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/598/)).
@theduderog Could you file a KIP for this API change as well?
@hjafarpour  Could you file a KIP for this API change as well?

Indeed it looks like brew installs this:

```
$ brew info kafka
kafka: stable 0.10.0.1 (bottled)
```

While the quickstart mentions `0.10.1.0`.

I'll close for now and will try again with a later version.
@guozhangwang @dguy @enothereska @miguno
